title: Master Affiliate Marketing With this Step-by-Step Guide
headline: This free online course provides entrepreneurs with a step-by-step guide in affiliate marketing
description: This free online course takes a step-by-step approach to help you start making money online with affiliate marketing. Affiliate marketing allows you to sell products and services from other people or businesses without the stress of keeping inventory. It also has the advantage of a very minimal capital outlay. We will help you find companies interested in giving you money to partner with them in selling their products and services.
courseDescription:
Affiliate marketing helps you to make money online with no prior experience. Does the idea of generating income using affiliate commissions for different products and services intrigue you? This course will show you how to set up Facebook advertising campaigns to help you with this objective. It will also show you where to find the best affiliate marketing platforms, which affiliate networks are easy to sign up for, and we will provide a step-by-step process to drive internet traffic to your affiliate offers. You will also learn the techniques to design your landing page. You will learn how to build an email list of prospective customers that you can use to communicate directly with over other related products or services. You will also discover the advantages and disadvantages of affiliate marketing and ways to minimize the use of your start-up capital. The course highlights the critical five-step process that successful affiliate marketers use to identify the best niches to ensure the highest return on investment.

Affiliate marketing is a distinct and lucrative advertising model that is fast becoming popular globally. It’s an advertising model where a business compensates third-party publishers to increase web traffic to its goods and services. The perception of paying commission for the referred business came before affiliate marketing and the Internet. The principle of revenue distribution became mainstream in e-commerce in 1994 - almost four years after the beginning of the World Wide Web. The idea of affiliate advertising on the Internet was put into operation and later patented by William J. Tobin, the founder of PC Flowers & Gifts. PC Flowers and Gifts developed the business model of paying a commission on sales to the Prodigy Network, for which they later acquired a patent in 2000. Amazon started a similar program where people could place a text link or a banner on their site, redirecting them to the Amazon home page. If the visitor purchased a book, the associate received a small percentage of the sale. Amazon didn’t start with this sort of affiliate program, but its program has become the most widely accepted method and has served as a model for subsequent programs.

Third-party publishers - referred to as affiliates - gain a small fee, incentivizing them to find ways to promote the company selling the commodities. With this understanding, it becomes a pay-for-performance marketing program where the act of selling is outsourced across a massive network. The World Wide Web and other similar technologies make it easier to implement the affiliate program, and businesses have improved the way they pay commissions on qualified leads. The ability to better track leads and sales contributes to improving their products. If you’d like to pursue affiliate marketing, you will benefit from this course, which will take you through its advantages and disadvantages. Here is your chance to make easy money online by starting this course today!

Start Course Now

• Learning Outcomes

  • Upon successful completion of this module, you will be able to:
    • Define the term affiliate marketing and viral marketing
    • Explain the difference between a merchant and a network
    • Identify a highly profitable niche using Google trends and other tools
    • Explain the difference between a publisher and a customer
    • Identify a conversion platform that will produce the most money with the least effort
    • Summarise the process required in creating content that your niche audience will want to read and share
    • Identify the best affiliate offers smartly and efficiently
    • Describe the steps needed to build an affiliate marketing business that will stand the test of time and track leading consumer trends
    • Identify opportunities to optimize your affiliate marketing business for increased income

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module A Guide to Affiliate Marketing are listed below:
    • Affiliate marketing is  a business model that lets people earn the right to promote somebody else's products and services.
    • Online gaming sites are a fast and efficient way for companies to promote their products.
    • Affiliate marketing accounts for over 15% of all digital media revenue.
    • Affiliate marketing exposes your products to new audiences through the promotional activities of your team of publishers.
    • Search engine optimization (SEO) is a method used to drive traffic to an Internet site.
    • Affiliate Marketing is derived from the concept of Revenue sharing.
    • A Merchant is sometimes known as the creator, the seller, the brand, the retailer, or the vendor.
    • An affiliate program refers to the package you create for your product, then made available to potential publishers.
    • Publisher sales activities are tracked through cookies and the unique publisher ID.
    • The USA has the largest market share in the affiliate industry, with over 39% share.
    • Affiliate marketing accounts for over 16% of all e-commerce orders in the USA and Canada.
  • NB: Please find attached additional notes on Affiliate Marketing in the Resource Section
